context_meta.title: Janelle Reeves: I Live In Provo, Utah And This Is My Style
context_meta.summary: Janelle Reeves is a 27-year-old stay-at-home mom and blogger who has been living in Provo, Utah, for nine years. According to her Instagram bio, she prioritizes modest fashion, body positivity and beauty. What makes the style in your city unique? Provo is a college town and brings people from all over the country, and even from different countries! I think that definitely influences the style and adds some diversity.

context_meta.title: 'It's A Vibrant Environment': Meet The People Of Detroit
context_meta.summary: Detroit was the twelfth stop on our Listen to America road trip. HuffPost chatted with folks in Campus Martius Park to find out what brings them to the city. Everything starts from here first.”― Charles Gathright II (center), independent contractor“I ain’t seen a city like it. No better, no worse. ...

context_meta.author: captainunderoos
context_meta.title: How An 'Open And Affirming' Church In Wyoming Is Redefining Community
context_meta.summary: When Rev. Dee Lundberg joined the United Church Of Christ in Casper, Wyoming, in 2008, the congregation was considering closing its doors. Six years earlier, the inclusive house of worship had announced itself as “open and affirming.” It would welcome everyone, and its clergy would perform same-sex weddings. After serving as an interim minister in the area, Lundberg came across a position at the struggling church.

context_meta.author: nanook
context_meta.title: The Reddest State In The Nation Isn't That Interested In The GOP's Moral Agenda
context_meta.summary: GILLETTE, Wyo. ― Marlayna Walker is a lifelong Christian. “I definitely don’t care about passing laws to prevent gays from adopting,” she said, bouncing her 18-month-old son, Zeke, in her arms outside a local bank in this northeastern Wyoming coal town. About 40 miles away in the tiny town of Wright, Lori Sanders is wiping down a counter at Hank’s Roadside Bar and Grill, a hot spot for local miners when they get off work.

text:
In Wyoming, you don't have to worry about the LGBT activists infringing on your rights.

I live in a liberal area, and they are forcing teaching in schools so that kids have to believe that homosexuality is morally OK, have transgender books in elementary schools for kids to read, and teach anal sex at a young age.  

I don't want year after year teaching to my kids in public school to subvert their moral teachings from at home.  This is their goal, to subvert parental moral teaching, they insist the school needs to teach this to match the liberal moral view.

Liberal school children no longer have the right to hold their own moral views towards sexuality.  This is wrong.  And something this naive Christian doesn't realize is being done.

context_meta.author: captainunderoos
context_meta.title: We Need To Save The Places That Make America Great
context_meta.summary: Last October, my family sold our house in Montana, our car and most of our stuff. What I didn’t expect from our cultural exchange was how spending time outside and on trails in Europe would give me such an appreciation for one of the things that makes the U.S. so great –- wild places.

context_meta.title: The Yellowstone Gateway Business Coalition Proves Democracy Works
context_meta.summary: Several years ago, two industrial-scale gold mines were proposed in the upper stretches of the Yellowstone River in areas that are more suited for elk, fly fishing and family vacations than industrial-sized mining. A few of us reached out to these foreign-owned mining companies because it was the neighborly thing to do.

context_meta.author: nanook
context_meta.title: What It Was Like Living Near A Superfund Site
context_meta.summary: Melissa Nootz and her family once lived in a Montana county containing a Superfund site. Now a Livingston, Montana resident, she reflects on the experience.

text: And it's all white!

context_meta.author: third_watch
context_meta.title: 7 Reasons Why Locals Love Casper, Wyoming
context_meta.summary: In Casper, Wyoming, you can fit a full vacation’s worth of activities into a single weekend. While Casper is world-renowned for blue-ribbon trout fishing in places like the famed Miracle Mile and Grey Reef stretches of the North Platte River, you don’t need to leave city limits to land the catch of a lifetime. Recent estimates of 2,200 trout per mile ― or about 2,400 pounds per mile ― put Casper’s downtown area squarely within blue-ribbon status.

context_meta.author: nanook
context_meta.title: Our Residents Are Proud To Call Casper, Wyoming Home
context_meta.summary: Here in the heart of Wyoming, we treasure our freedom and embrace the wide-open spaces that surround us. A main attraction you absolutely cannot miss is the North Platte River, a world-renowned blue-ribbon fishery, which also offers white water rafting, kayaking and scenic river float trips.

text: #8:  The population is overwhelming white, educated and employed.
